newsitem.title: FRANCE: Renault to sell parts for Iranian car.
newsitem.headline: Renault to sell parts for Iranian car.

text.p: French carmaker Renault SA said it had signed an agreement with the Iranian carmaker Kish Khodro to deliver mechanical parts for a new Iranian multi-purpose vehicle scheduled to go into production in 1998.
Renault said in a statement that the agreement entailed the delivery of parts from the Megane car collection, including 1.6 litre engines and gear boxes. The terms were not disclosed.

Kish Khodro is 51 percent held by private Iranian investors, 40 percent held by an Iranian state bank, with the rest of the capital in the hands of a British engineering group, BMS Management, which designed the MPV, Renault said.

Kish Khodro is scheduled to start building an assembly plant this month on the Gulf island of Kish, with production set to begin in mid-1998. Production is expected to reach 5,000 vehicles annually for domestic consumption and export.
